name: envisage
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
C1 to imagine or expect something in the future, especially something good: Train fare increases of 15 percent are envisaged for the next year. [ + that ] It's envisaged that building will start at the end of this year. [ + -ing verb ] When do you envisage finishing the project? [ + question word ] It's hard to envisage how it might happen.
to form a mental picture of something or someone you have never seen: He wasn't what I'd expected - I'd envisaged someone much taller.
